definition: see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Kant: Excerpts from Metaphysics of Morals.
sentences.chinese: 节录自康德《道德形上学》。

sentences.english: The following is an excerpt from an article by Tina at Think Simple Now.
sentences.chinese: 下面这篇文章节录自Tina的《现在轻松看一切》。

sentences.english: Mill, J. S. Excerpts from Utilitarianism.
What are the chances of Bible prophecy not coming to pass?
sentences.chinese: 以下节录自圣经中的预言有可能不应验吗？

sentences.english: Here are edited excerpts of their conversation
sentences.chinese: 以下是经过编辑的谈话节录。

sentences.english: Assumed Liabilities excerpt from a model agreement, with comments.
sentences.chinese: 自模型协定中节录出的假设债务，和评论。

sentences.english: " Excerpts " refers to the documentary evidence copied down from parts of the contents of the reserved copy.
sentences.chinese: 节录本是指摘抄原文件部分内容的书证。

sentences.english: J. S. Mill, excerpts from Utilitarianism.

definition: excerpt/selection (from a book)/to select/to choose an extract
preface/foreword/preamble/recital (law)/also written 敘文|叙文[xu4 wen2]
short comment or critical appraisal added at the end of a text, on a painting etc
author's preface/autobiographical notes as introduction to a book
interpreting words/to explain the meaning of words in classic texts/to decipher an old script
to compose (a piece of writing)/to write/(written) work/writer
for the benefit of the reader
notes on the use of a book/guide to the reader
